intro: Viola fusiformis, commonly known as the spindle viola, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive wavy margin and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of purple and violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viola fusiformis is often found in woodland floors and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
